document_title: Thyroid disease: Signs, causes, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: nhan-tuyen-giap.json_6_Subjects who need to be screened for thyroid cancer (malignant thyroid nodules):
subsection_content:
Finally, the following subjects need to have their thyroid examined to detect cases of malignant thyroid nodules (thyroid cancer) early, including: young people <14 years old or elderly people >70 years old to detect thyroid nodules and thyroid nodules. Rapid growth in size, symptoms of hoarseness, history of radiotherapy to the head, face and neck area or family history of thyroid cancer.
Most cases of thyroid cancer are curable and rarely cause life-threatening problems if detected early and treated promptly.

Most cases of thyroid cancer are curable and rarely cause life-threatening problems if detected early and treated promptly.
